medical_history.chief_complaint: Episodes of anger that are sudden, intense, and inappropriate to the situation.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The episodes began about 10 months prior to the assessment after a series of stressful life events, including the loss of his mother and family issues. He described these episodes as having a 'short fuse,' feeling out of control very quickly, and experiencing an explosive temper. During episodes, he noted an increase in heart rate and flushing, lasting around an hour before recovery. He denied having similar episodes in the past.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of short-term therapy for marital problems 12 years earlier. Denied a history of mania, hypomania, head injury, seizures, or drug or alcohol abuse. Notable family history of alcoholism (mother) and paranoia (father).
medical_history.family_history: Mother with probable alcoholism; father had a history of paranoia.
